intro: Randia fratrum, commonly known as the purple randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Randia fratrum typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain several seeds.
